title: add an assert within setup_module to check if git was configured
body:
ATM many tests would simply start to fail and even nose itself would then freak out
```
======================================================================
ERROR: Failure: TypeError (issubclass() arg 1 must be a class)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/failure.py", line 39, in runTest
    raise self.exc_val.with_traceback(self.tb)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/loader.py", line 523, in makeTest
    return self._makeTest(obj, parent)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.5/site-packages/nose/loader.py", line 576, in _makeTest
    if issubclass(parent, unittest.TestCase):
TypeError: issubclass() arg 1 must be a class
```
making it not really obvious of what is going on. so we better check if user.email and user.name are set in the config before we proceed to test anything

edit 1: actually this exception remains even after I set user config, so #1436
